      • parse

        public java.util.List<KsqlParser.ParsedStatement> parse(java.lang.String sql)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Parse the statement(s) in supplied sql.

        Note: the state of the execution context will not be changed.

        Specified by:
        parse in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Parameters:
        sql - the statements to parse.
        Returns:
        the list of prepared statements.

      • prepare

        public KsqlParser.PreparedStatement<?> prepare(KsqlParser.ParsedStatement stmt,
                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> variablesMap)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Prepare the supplied statement for execution.

        This provides some level of validation as well, e.g. ensuring sources and topics exist in the metastore, etc.

        If variables are used in the statement, they will be replaced with the values found in variablesMap.

        Specified by:
        prepare in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Parameters:
        stmt - the parsed statement.
        variablesMap - a list of values for SQL variable substitution
        Returns:
        the prepared statement.

      • execute

        public KsqlExecutionContext.ExecuteResult execute(ServiceContext serviceContext,
                                                  ConfiguredStatement<?> statement)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Execute the supplied statement, updating the meta store and registering any query.

        The statement must be executable. See isExecutableStatement(io.confluent.ksql.parser.tree.Statement).

        If the statement contains a query, then it will be tracked, but not started.

        The statement is executed using the specific ServiceContext

        Specified by:
        execute in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Parameters:
        serviceContext - The ServiceContext of the user executing the statement.
        statement - The SQL to execute.
        Returns:
        The execution result.

      • executeQuery

        public TransientQueryMetadata executeQuery(ServiceContext serviceContext,
                                           ConfiguredStatement<Query> statement,
                                           boolean excludeTombstones)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Executes a query using the supplied service context.
        Specified by:
        executeQuery in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Returns:
        the query metadata

      • executeScalablePushQuery

        public ScalablePushQueryMetadata executeScalablePushQuery(ServiceContext serviceContext,
                                                          ConfiguredStatement<Query> statement,
                                                          PushRouting pushRouting,
                                                          PushRoutingOptions pushRoutingOptions,
                                                          QueryPlannerOptions queryPlannerOptions,
                                                          io.vertx.core.Context context)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Executes a scalable push query by first creating a logical plan and then translating it to a physical plan. The physical plan is then traversed for every row that's passing through the topology's output.
        Specified by:
        executeScalablePushQuery in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Parameters:
        serviceContext - The service context to execute the query in
        statement - The scalable push query
        pushRouting - The push routing object
        pushRoutingOptions - The options for routing
        context - The Vertx context of the request
        Returns:
        A ScalablePushQueryMetadata object

      • executePullQuery

        public PullQueryResult executePullQuery(ServiceContext serviceContext,
                                        ConfiguredStatement<Query> statement,
                                        HARouting routing,
                                        RoutingOptions routingOptions,
                                        QueryPlannerOptions plannerOptions,
                                        java.util.Optional<PullQueryExecutorMetrics> pullQueryMetrics,
                                        boolean startImmediately)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlExecutionContext
        Executes a pull query by first creating a logical plan and then translating it to a physical plan. The physical plan is then traversed for every row in the state store.
        Specified by:
        executePullQuery in interface KsqlExecutionContext
        Parameters:
        serviceContext - The service context to execute the query in
        statement - The pull query
        routingOptions - Configuration parameters used for routing requests
        pullQueryMetrics - JMX metrics
        startImmediately - Whether to start the pull query immediately. If not, the caller must call PullQueryResult.start to start the query.
        Returns:
        the rows that are the result of the query evaluation.

      • close

        public void close(boolean closeQueries)
        Parameters:
        closeQueries - whether or not to clean up the local state for any running queries

      • isExecutableStatement

        public static boolean isExecutableStatement(Statement statement)
        Determines if a statement is executable by the engine.
        Parameters:
        statement - the statement to test.
        Returns:
        true if the engine can execute the statement, false otherwise
